attributes.action: As with perjury, hold politicians in contempt of the realm if they lie publicly.
attributes.background:
Perjury: the offence of wilfully telling an untruth or making a misrepresentation under oath.
If you lie in court you can be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of up to 7 years. 
If you are a politician however, who lies under oath religiously to the public, then you usually receive a promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen the effect of such lies told to the country, yet those responsible for their gross misrepresentations continue to enjoy their profession having never been held legally accountable for the horrendous damage caused by their deceitful rhetoric. 

Make lying to the public, whilst in office, the same offence as lying in court.

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to £1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is £325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: Raise awareness about Motorcyclist for drivers. Add a Section for Practical test
attributes.background:
Many Car drivers are not very aware of Motorcyclist. I have seen many fatal accidents and it is now time to raise awareness for learners and normal drivers.
If they fail to show any awareness about Motorcyclist they must retake their test.

attributes.action: Ensure all Cafcass calls and meetings are recorded and both parties get a copy
attributes.background: Due to personal experience of having a Cafcass telephone interview not reflect my issues, I began to look at net mums and other site representative of both sexes and I've found many people found this happening. All calls and meetings should be recorded for safety to ensure key information is saved.
attributes.additional_details: Since most organisations like insurances record calls it seems a serious failing data gathered in the best interest of a child is not recorded. If a report does not reflect what a parent or other person says the recording could be sent to court to validate the person. A report missing key information causes distress and goes against the person as the court presume Cafcass to be efficient. Recording provides proof for all parties.

attributes.action: A law that Family Courts factor evidence of Alienation Inducement in its ruling
attributes.background: Children being alienated from one parent by another is common in Family Court contact requests or custody cases. This is psychologically harmful to the child and prolongs the court process unnecessarily. There are many papers about Alienation Inducement and the consequent Parent Alienation Syndrome

attributes.action: Bring the National Insurance system in-line with that of Income Tax
attributes.background: The weekly amount of pay after which all employees have to start paying National Insurance contributions has not been increased in line with the 'headline-grabbing' increases to the Personal Allowance for Income tax and represents a major penalty to business, especially those who employ themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'Primary Earnings Threshold' (weekly earnings) for commencement of National Insurance contributions has increased by an amount of just £16 since 2011/12; an increase of just over 10%. https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516787/Table-a4.pdf 
The Personal Allowance for Income Tax from over the same time to 2017/18, by contrast, represents an increase of over 50%.
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516769/Table-a1.pdf

attributes.action: Debate homes sold to anyone outside of UK to carry a stamp duty levy of 50%.
attributes.background: London’s housing market has become a “safe haven” for corrupt money from across the world that is contributing to the crisis in home ownership in the capital, a report has suggested.
attributes.additional_details:
Transparency International, an anti-corruption group, said that it had found evidence that 1,616 of the homes in 14 developments it examined in central London had been bought by individuals or companies registered abroad, compared with 450 registered to Britons.

It added that 40%of the purchases, totalling £1.6 billion, were bought by investors from countries with a “high risk” of corruption.

We owe it to our children, the next generation, to act now before our country is sold off!!!

attributes.action: Make St. David's day (March 1st) a public holiday in Wales
attributes.background: I believe that St. David's day should be a public holiday for the Welsh. This was declined by Tony Blair in the past even though a majority (87%!) Wanted the change.

attributes.action: Reduce the house of Lords to an equal number of MP
attributes.background:
How can so many unqualified people who are unelected have a direct influence over policy made by elected MPs? 
Reducing the numbers will save huge costs and leave qualified people who are accountable to Parliament. There should never be more Lords than MPs.
attributes.additional_details: Members of Lords to be selected by committee every 4 years

attributes.action: Review the sentencing length of crimes and abuse committed by care workers
attributes.background: Recent articles published concerning persons at risk who have been abused by care workers have received minimal sentencing after being found guilty of the crime.  Persons at risk and families should feel safe by the care provided and not intimidated by inappropriate behaviour of care staff
attributes.additional_details:
Community Care article - Poor training of care home staff leaving residents at risk, investigation finds.
28.10.15
The Guardian - Care Homer worker jailed for abuse of 89 year old caught on hidden camera - received only 4 months

attributes.action: Make all car insurers allow drivers to volunteer for the NHS, by use of the car.
attributes.background: I am shocked to learn that I am not allowed to volunteer to help the NHS by doing a volunteering job, by helping patients get to their appointments at hospital and back home. This is what they would call business use of the vehicle, and this is what I would call a breach of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: I received an email from my insurer which said: “Thank you for choosing Debenhams Car Insurance. Please note that you are not covered for carrying passengers as this is considered as business use.”

attributes.action: Force social media to verify its members more throughly to help stop bullying.
attributes.background: Bullying on social media is out of control. It's so easy for someone to say hurtful things, to someone else online that would otherwise been deemed unacceptable in person. These comments are demoralising, hurtful and depressing and are often said without any thoughts of the person they're aimed at.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media needs to offer more protection, help and support to its young, old, vulnerable and genuine members. Banning a troll member is not enough, as they can easily setup another account with a email address and start trolling again. 
Social media needs to verify new members more throughly with debt / credit or electoral register info and ban for life those intent on causing harm to others. Encourage members to take more responsibility for their comments by showing they are a real person.

attributes.action: Review Police policies instantly rejecting candidates with visible tattoos
attributes.background: Current policies for recruitment within the force is to completely reject candidates, regardless the level of application, if the person has visible tattoos irrespective of their nature.They are looking to diversify by employing new recruits from different cultures but are contradicting that message
attributes.additional_details: Its worrying that people are being judged on appearance and not ability, if the tattoos are non offensive. Statistics show that in 2015 approximately one in 5 uk people have tattoos, this figure set to rise dramatically by 2025. Peoples attitudes to tattoos are changing and if the Home Office don't look at altering the current policies they are not only restricting good quality candidates but could find that police may be excluding themselves from certain communities within their jurisdiction.

attributes.action: UK government vote of no confidence.
attributes.background:
lets send a strong massage to the torries that we have no confidence 
 in them to run our affairs in Scotland and UK wide.
we demand as one people the conservative party steps down.

attributes.action: Stop schools using isolation rooms as punishment for students
attributes.background: Stop schools from using Isolation rooms as punishment for students not only disabled ones or sen ones but for all students. Schools are punishing students more than too often with these rooms they are  abusing their powers as teachers and ignoring the fact they are there to teach not punish.

attributes.action: Allow small businesses to have the same consumer rights as an individual.
attributes.background: Small businesses are being targeted by larger businesses to unfair contract terms, outrageous drop out penalties/clauses & higher prices. Yet, because we are a small business we have little or no consumer protection. Help make this change and allow a fairer marketplace for small business consumers.

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is removed.
attributes.background:
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension by a minimum of 2.5% a year. 

Guaranteed rises in the state pension worsen generational inequality.
attributes.additional_details: With the EU Referendum in mind it is more important than ever that we are all affected equally by our economic policy decisions.

attributes.action: Allow students undertaking work experience the right to accept/be paid
attributes.background: As of right now students who need to undertake work experience in order to complete their course are unable to accept pay from their work experience. Students have to take a large amount of time off from their usual jobs to complete work experience and most will miss out on a large amount of pay.
attributes.additional_details: Missing work, means missing pay and for some missing pay is the difference between being able to pay rent or not, being able to afford bills or even being able to afford food.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Nit Nurse and make lice treatments free for children up to age 16
attributes.background: The lack of nit education and Nit treatments being taken off the minor ailment scheme results in more infestations and less treatment being administered. With most brands of treatment ranging from £8-£15 per treatment it is a costly affair to treat the whole family effectively.
attributes.additional_details: The reinstatement of the Nit Nurse in all primary schools and the access to free head lice treatment will go a long way to combat the problem.

attributes.action: Divert our "special relationship" from USA to Mexico.
attributes.background: We have a "special relationship" with America. It means nothing at all - there are no favours through that relationship.
attributes.additional_details: It is symbolic and I don’t think we should be symbolically aligning to somewhere run by someone who makes inappropriate remarks about children, who imposes executive orders which may be illegal.

attributes.action: Focus a larger portion of the defence budget on service personel.
attributes.background: Early terminations from the armed forces is at an all time high. The priorities of the chain of comand are certainly proportionally aimed at staff retention. However new legislation brought by the Army2020, such as, the planned scrapping of the commitment bonus scheme contradicts this completely.
attributes.additional_details: Other plans such as the increase in prices for SFA to bring it into line with the private housing market are evidence of the mindless eradication of the few remaining factors that keep todays service men and women HAPPY to remain in the services. Pensions, pay, accommodation cost, catering contracts, SFA standards, the CarillionAmey contract for the MoD estate. ALL of these points need addressing in order to provide the level of retention the army needs to function.

attributes.action: If a person has a multiple birth they should be given more time off work.
attributes.background: Why should you get 1 year off for one baby and the same amount of time for more than one. If someone has multiples it's really hard to bond or even get in a routine.
attributes.additional_details: It's stressful trying to find childcare for more than one baby also while there only 9 month I really believe multiple mums should get more time off work

attributes.action: To listen to the people and to trigger the article 50 so we can Brexit.
attributes.background: The people of England have spoken we need the article 50 to be triggered. We have voted for this country to be out of the EU.Therefore the government should listen to its people.
attributes.additional_details: We joined the EU for trading only NOT to be under their laws as suggested. We want democracy not to be the EU's puppets.

attributes.action: Urge Broadband Companies to change old aluminium wires to copper for fibre optic
attributes.background: I have an old aluminium line that goes a fair distance which causes a lot of drop off in the connection, as aluminium is a worse conductor in comparison to copper. Households across England get offered broadband packages that connection lines cannot deliver due to old forgotten aluminium cables.
attributes.additional_details: I live in Milton Keynes, in an area called two mile ash where aluminium is used, I am fairly far away from the cabinet I’m connected to which causes me to get a max connection of 10.5Mbps download and 1Mbps upload. Houses further than me experience a worse drop off rate however an area near me called Emerson valley, where they've used copper can reach speeds of 54Mbps download and 13Mbps upload copper makes a big difference and should be the standard for a modern faster England.

attributes.action: Fully fund A&E and urgent care by a specific A&E tax paid by most people.
attributes.background: There is national alarm at the state of many A and E departments with excessive waiting times and some inappropriate use by people who should be treated elsewhere. Separate funding paid for fully by a broad based tax to which most if not all contribute is needed to provide sufficient urgent care.
attributes.additional_details:
Refer to sensible views of Philippa Whitford in the NHS and Social Care funding in the House of Commons on Jan 11th 2017. She presents the impressive model as practised in Scotland.
Everyone knows that A and E is not coping in many parts of the country. This is exacerbated by the lack of GP availability out of hours and at weekends. Demand has risen due to an ageing population and lack of alternative facilities. A and E is one of the few services that virtually everybody will use in their lives.

attributes.action: Rape offences tried on the balance of probability NOT beyond reasonable doubt
attributes.background: In the UK the conviction rate for rape cases is 4% this is not encouraging for rape victims to come forward. It is extremely difficult to convince a jury to convict a perpetrator beyond all reasonable doubt this is why the numbers are so low I propose I change in the law to help victims of rape
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from The British Crime Survey reveal that 89% of rapes go unreported, and 38% of victims don’t tell anyone. It is unrealistic to assess a rape case beyond all reasonable doubt if the victim is known to the defendant or is the defendants partner etc this is virtually impossible as there will always be the argument of consensual sex therefore giving the element of doubt. 97% of calls to the Rape Crisis helpline are from victims who knew their attackers, if we try defendants based on the balance of probability we will have a better chance of convictions and will incourage more victims to come forward.

attributes.action: Nominate Tunstall Tower Square as a UNESCO World Heritage Site
attributes.background: Tunstall Tower Square in Stoke on Trent is an indicative example of Tower squares across the country. In an area of high cultural significance for the country and for the industrial revolution which changed the world forever the Tower Square should be protected.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all companies to recycle
attributes.background: Currently companies including large multinational ones such as macdonalds, cineworld and other industrial companies use plenty of material that is recyclable. However I have noticed that most don't offer the option to do so and most of this material ends up in landfill.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies open to the public should provide recycling stations where the discarded items can be separated into recyclable and non-recyclable waste. 
All businesses should manage their waste into these categories to help protect the environment for all life on earth.

attributes.action: The Government should recognise Taiwan's right for national self determination.
attributes.background: The UK Government should revise its view of the 'One China Policy' to recognize that Taiwan is a beacon of democracy in Asia and that it is for the people of Taiwan to decide their future and not the Chinese Communist Party, which is known to be an authoritarian and oppressive government.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not about requesting that the UK Government recognises Taiwan as a country but instead that it recognises that it is for the people of Taiwan to determine their future free of threats from the Chinese Government.

The Chinese Government's claim to control the destiny of the people Taiwan is a dangerous and outdated philosophy based on colonialism. This is because although Taiwan was once part of mainland China it has not been for almost a 120 years.

attributes.action: Give HMRC more funding to help stamp out tax evasion.
attributes.background: Tax fraud costs the government  £16bn every year. HMRC are making cuts to "save money" in reality these job losses are hurting the economy. Tax avoidance is hurting services like the NHS and is leading to low earning citizens having to pay higher taxes. Sign to make the government give more funding.

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Abolish Income Tax
attributes.background:
Income tax in the UK was introduced in 1799 as a TEMPORARY measure to fund the Napoleonic wars which ended in 1815. Income tax was abolished in 1816. 
It was later reinstalled in 1842 due to there being a growing deficit.
attributes.additional_details:
In today's society absolutely everything is taxed. For many people in minimum wage jobs this makes day to day survival a struggle. By abolishing income tax this would give them an extra £60-£80 a month which would be put towards improving their quality of life.
Many people could use this money to feed/clothe/shelter their families and as stated EVERYTHING is taxed therefore is there any need for income tax for everyone to prosper?

attributes.action: Diwali is Hindu festival and for lot of Hindu it is also their New year as well.
attributes.background: If Diwali is made as a National Holiday like Christmas then it will save Hindu people to use their holiday

attributes.action: Redirect the estate of those who die intestate from Prince Charles to the NHS.
attributes.background: Currently Prince Charles receives the estate of those dying intestate (without a will or any relevant surviving relatives) in Cornwall. This petition requests the law is changed so that money is given to the NHS rather than to the prince.

attributes.action: Review funding into public services. Local authorities, NHS,police etc need help
attributes.background: Working in the public sector I have seen a decline in the last few years and knowing what future budgets hold I fear for communities. Had funding been correct over the years then there wouldn't be issues such as complaints on GP access or lack of bin collections etc
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence here is qualitative:
We all know someone who:

* Has struggled to see a doctor 
* Is homeless or can't get housing 
* Parents who scramble each year for a decent school place
* who is struggling to afford to eat
* works too many hours because they can't afford childcare 
* damaged a tyre due to pot holes in roads 
* Lack of landscaping 
* crime not responded too

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Pass a law that does what the Children & Young Persons Act 1933 is meant to do.
attributes.background: The Children & Young Persons Act 1933 says it is illegal for a child who is younger than 13, to assist in a non-performance trade or occupation carried on for profit. In many cases such as in research this law is not enforced. Therefore a fully enforceable law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Hundreds of thousands of children younger than 13 are employed in the UK in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy (ISBN1845298802). Child Employment Officers do not give them the protection they give children in performance work such as modelling & acting. Irrespective of the above Act the Officers do not regard them as being employed (NNCEE). This, and the lack of protection, undermines their rights as workers, and can result in them being mistreated & deprived of pay (ACAS).

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances with a patient on board the right to use bus lanes any time.
attributes.background: As Ambulance crew it is very frustrating to have to sit in a endless queue of traffic with a patient on board who although may not be in a life threatening condition may be distressed or in pain while a empty bus lane is available. If empty Taxis and solo mopeds can use them then why not a Ambulance

attributes.action: Ban the use of loud fireworks in residential areas
attributes.background: Many animals find fireworks scary. It is estimated that 45 per cent of dogs and other animals in the UK show signs of fear when they hear fireworks (RSPCA). This can include toileting indoors, shaking, barking and crying. Fireworks should not be used in a residential area to avoid animal distress.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks should not be allowed in residential areas, and should only be allowed in a licensed settings on set days, not days or weeks before/after the event.

attributes.action: Change Religious Education to Religious and Cultural Studies
attributes.background: Students should be taught more than just basic religious principles. Teaching children about other races and cultures will help stamp out racism in our ever-progressing and diverse society.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the biggest cities in the UK (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol and Cardiff) are among the most diverse in Europe. Our youth should be accepting of their peers whatever their heritage, especially in the wake of Brexit and the rising level of hate crime.

attributes.action:
Petition
Allow farmers to grow hemp without restriction.
attributes.background: Remove all restrictions on growing industrial hemp. Although the industrial strains of the plant have no psychoactive potential, the absurd level of control has effectively destroyed its value as an agricultural crop. The fibres , the oils , plastics- endless possibilities all natural
attributes.additional_details: Bees on the endangered species list - kind of important due to pollination - bees love hemp..

attributes.action: Bring back the paper tax disc.
attributes.background: Bring back the paper tax disc, as you can view the tax disc on your screen and can be seen, that you have a tax disc and have the tax, as people are not paying the tax, as well all the tax should go towards the up keep of the road only and not to be used with other tax.
attributes.additional_details: The DVLA hasn't done enough to tell people when they need to pay. When your tax is due, you get a reminder letter, but this is not enough for thousands of people, who forget their renewal date, and can face a fine of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to force pupils to sing religious songs
attributes.background: It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed
attributes.additional_details: The law states that religious and non religious schools must take part in some form of collective worship and that it must only be of christian character which isn't reflective of the demographic

attributes.action: Create a specialist police unit to deal with modern day slavery.
attributes.background: Modern day slavery is a big issue in the UK with the amount of people referred to the National Referral Mechanism up. I believe that the UK Government should create a national modern slavery unit to crack down on modern day slave owners and the human traffickers that get them into the country.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government's Modern Slavery Strategy:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/383764/Modern_Slavery_Strategy_FINAL_DEC2015.pdf

The National Crime Agency's statistics on Slavery:
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/publications/national-referral-mechanism-statistics

attributes.action: To be able to claim carers allowance per person that you care for
attributes.background: Iam a mother of two children who both receive middle rate DLA for there disability Primary Ciliary Dyskinesia. Currently as the system works you can only claim carers allowance for 1 child / adult , even through when caring for two is double the work load and time spent.

attributes.action: Cap graduation fees for university students.
attributes.background:
University graduation costs have become too expensive. Many universities charge  between £20 to £40 a ticket for each family member. This is not accessible to those who are on lower incomes in any way.

Cap what they can charge, and make this more accessible to all students and their families.

attributes.action: Restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee to the House of Lords.
attributes.background: The House of Lords is no longer independent of the political parties in the House of Commons, leading to the destruction of the British Parliamentary system. We have lost Liberty and Justice because of this. To correct this we must restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee in the Lords.
attributes.additional_details: We are now leaving the EU, so we should set about restoring the institutions of the British state, which the EU has undermined with the support the political parties in the House of Commons. The House of Lords should be a House of legacy and law, a check on the power of political parties and the government. The political parties should no longer be able to stack the House to block the will of the British people.

attributes.action: Scottish vote for independence! The Scottish government pays!
attributes.background: The Scottish government has had it's chance. The rest of the of the UK should not have to pay because the First Minister did not like the result of the first vote.
